title.native: モンスター娘のいる日常
title.english: Monster Musume: Everyday Life With Monster Girls

description:
Monsters: they're real, and they want to date us!

Three years ago, the world learned that harpies, centaurs, catgirls, and all manners of fabulous creatures are not merely fiction; they are flesh and blood - not to mention scale, feather, horn, and fang. Thanks to the "Cultural Exchange Between Species Act," these once-mythical creatures have assimilated into society, or at least, they're trying.

When a hapless human teenager named Kurusu Kimihito is inducted as a "volunteer" into the government exchange program, his world is turned upside down. A snake-like lamia named Miia comes to live with him, and it is Kurusu's job to take care of her and make sure she integrates into his everyday life.

Unfortunately for Kurusu, Miia is undeniably sexy, and the law against interspecies breeding is very strict. Even worse, when a ravishing centaur girl and a flirtatious harpy move in, what's a full-blooded teenage human with raging hormones to do?!

(Source: Anime News Network)
synonyms: บันทึกอุ่นรักสาวมอนสเตอร์

tags.name: Monster Girl
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who is part-monster.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Large Breasts
tags.description: Features a character with larger-than-average breasts.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Cohabitation
tags.description: Features two or more people who live in the same household and develop a romantic or sexual relationship.

tags.name: Centaur
tags.description: Prominently features a character with a human upper body and the lower body of a horse.

tags.name: Seinen
tags.description: Target demographic is adult males.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Mermaid
tags.description: A mythological creature with the body of a human and the tail of a fish.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: Dullahan
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a Dullahan, a creature from Irish Folklore with a head that can be detached from its main body.

tags.name: Zombie
tags.description: Prominently features reanimated corpses which often prey on live humans and turn them into zombies.

tags.name: Chuunibyou
tags.description: Prominently features a character with "Middle School 2nd Year Syndrome", who either acts like a know-it-all adult or falsely believes they have special powers.

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Bisexual
tags.description: Features a character who is romantically or sexually attracted to people of more than one sex or gender.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

マーラウン・ロリライ

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/okayado1215) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=267014)

Takemaru Inui is a Japanese manga artist best known for his New York Times best selling series Monster Musume and 12 Beast. He visited North America for the first time as a special guest at Anime Expo 2016

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/325492584) | [Sakugabooru](https://www.sakugabooru.com/post?tags=tatsuya_yoshihara)

Freelance animator formerly affiliated with [Actas](https://anilist.co/studio/60/) where he was attending its internal animation school and debuted as animator at the age of 20. His work has been greatly influenced by contemporary Kanada school animators [Seiya Numata](https://anilist.co/staff/124320/) and [Hironori Tanaka](https://anilist.co/staff/103979/). 

He's a precocious talent, debuting as episode director at the age of 21 and as director at the age of 23 with [Arve Rezzle](https://anilist.co/anime/13863/), as part of the Young Animator Training Project.

Married to fellow animator [Kikuko Sadakata](https://anilist.co/staff/105769).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/125951990) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/users/877227) | [Fanbox](https://misopetha-menos.fanbox.cc/)

Originating from [Sunshine Corporation](https://anilist.co/studio/7108/).

Close friends with [Shunji Akasaka](https://anilist.co/staff/157902/)

Heavily inspired by [Tatsuya Yoshihara](https://anilist.co/staff/112047/), he follows him in most of his series, such as [Black Clover](https://anilist.co/anime/97940/), [Monster Musume no Iru Nichijou](https://anilist.co/anime/21093/) and [Namiuchigiwa no Muromisan](https://anilist.co/anime/16910/) on which he worked as an Animator, Animation Director or Character Designer.

He is best known for his work as a Chief Animation Director on Black Clover, and he has a deep respect for [Yuuki Tabata](https://anilist.co/staff/110063/)'s art and tries to transmit it in his corrections with his friend [Shunji Akasaka](https://anilist.co/staff/157902/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/125951990) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/users/877227) | [Fanbox](https://misopetha-menos.fanbox.cc/)

Originating from [Sunshine Corporation](https://anilist.co/studio/7108/).

Close friends with [Shunji Akasaka](https://anilist.co/staff/157902/)

Heavily inspired by [Tatsuya Yoshihara](https://anilist.co/staff/112047/), he follows him in most of his series, such as [Black Clover](https://anilist.co/anime/97940/), [Monster Musume no Iru Nichijou](https://anilist.co/anime/21093/) and [Namiuchigiwa no Muromisan](https://anilist.co/anime/16910/) on which he worked as an Animator, Animation Director or Character Designer.

He is best known for his work as a Chief Animation Director on Black Clover, and he has a deep respect for [Yuuki Tabata](https://anilist.co/staff/110063/)'s art and tries to transmit it in his corrections with his friend [Shunji Akasaka](https://anilist.co/staff/157902/).
Morijiri Kazuaki (森尻和明) is a producer.

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mikamw)**

**Masataka Mikami** is a Japanese music producer.
__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yottkun)__ __Yoshihiro Furusawa__ is a Japanese producer and animation planner.
Also is a writer, producer and director for ADV Films and Robotboy Films.
